title: Two gmail accounts, same settings, can only get IMAP mail from one
content:
I use 2 different gmail accounts for different purposes. I get mail for AccountA via IMAP on Thunderbird, no problem, and have for years. For over a year now I've been unable to collect mail for my second-string address, AccountB, on Thunderbird, and have had to get it in the browser.

I've finally decided to do something about this. I removed AccountB from Thunderbird & set it up again. I'm using the exact same settings (in Thunderbird and in Gmail) that I do for AccountA, the only difference is the password. I've double-checked the password, too. But when I try to connect, I get a pop-up:

titled: Enter credentials for AccountB@gmail.com on imap.gmail.com [a very long URL which I've copied & saved] page from Google:

400. That's an error. The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That's all we know.

Thanks a heap, guys!

Is this problem coming from Thunderbird, or from Google? What do I do now?

Thanks,

MEC
creator: curtin.me

title: in my message filtering, how do I specify that an email address exists in my address book
content:
I've set up filters to eliminate all the spam I get, using a White list and a Black list. While that mostly worked, I wanted a better idea. So I got rid of the blacklist, and just have a White list. If any email address isn't in the White list, I want the email to be automatically transferred to the Junk emal folder.

The concept seems to work, except that I want to also accept all email in my address book when it falls thru the whitelist filter, but I don't know how to specify this. Is it possible?

title: Problemi vari: aiuto!
content:
Ciao a tutti. Non so cosa sia successo in passato (forse qualche versione beta ha incasinato tutto), ma da un bel po' Thunderbird presenta vari problemi: - impossibile cancellare uno o più account e relativi messaggi - impossibile modificare le impostazioni: tornano sempre a quelle di default - ricezione del messaggi lenta: dopo aver chiesto di scaricarli passano 5/7 minuti prima di vederne uno - continuo messaggio di errore (crash) una volta chiuso il programma

In sostanza non ne posso più, ma ho circa 10 anni di email di lavoro gestiti da Thunderbird e non vorrei cambiare. Ho installato Thunderbird su un altro computer e funziona alla perfezione, ma quando gli dico di usare il vecchio profilo (copiato e incollato sul nuovo PC) tutto smette di funzionare.

In sintesi: vorrei migrare tutti i messaggi e relative cartelle su un nuovo profilo senza tenere le impostazioni del vecchio profilo.

Qualcuno mi può aiutare? Grazie

title: Deleting an email - With Remote content Allowed vs. Disallowed
content:
I'm using the latest version of TB: 128.4.3esr (32-bit) . . . But, I think I have noticed this on previous versions, also.

I like to Disallow Remote content from loading, for security purposes, and then to select to Allow it or not.

But I notice that if Remote content is Disallowed, when I click to delete the email, sometimes it works as expected, and sometimes it does not. The problem is, it's like it deletes it, but then another copy of the email appears. It will not delete. I have to hit Escape, and then delete it in the list. Then that does nothing. I have to close and re-open TB to see that the email is gone.

This is in contrast to how if I just Allow Remote content, deleting an email always works as expected, but then there is the security risk.

If you get a lot of emails you don't want, it's nice to be able to delete them quickly.

What is hanging it up, if you Disallow Remote content?

I have tried Deleting smart mailboxes and virtualFolders.dat . . . This didn't do anything

title: All emails in one folder disappeared, and all after 11/7/2024 in another folder also disappeared
content:
Two strange things happened with my Thunderbird emails today, all POP3. In the folder with emails from my sister (top folder with a few hundred emails, subfolders going back to 2004 with thousands of emails), all the emails after Nov. 7 had disappeared. That could be a only a couple of dozen emails. They also disappeared from my iPhone. (Now play the Twilight Zone music).

Then there is a folder called Randy (me) with various subfolders going back as long. Many fewer emails were there. It was mostly for receiving bcc's of emails sent from my iPhone, and most of those had been moved immediately to my Sent folders. They are still there. But there still should have been hundreds of emails. Every single one, plus all the subfolders, have disappeared.

A fix I've seen here might be to rebuild the entire message database. That would only work if the messages were still there but simply not synced any more. Last time I did it I had all the messages, but the search function had become erratic. It took overnight. Given that I still have most of my emails and the search function seems to be working, I'm afraid that I could do more harm than good by rebuilding the database.

I have my entire TB profile backed up. I could use that, but then I'd lose everything in/out since 10 days ago, when I left on an extended trip to France. That would include lots of daily reporting to friends and family about the trip.

There doesn't seem to be any way to restore just one folder, which would be ideal.

Thanks for any suggestions.
creator: rbrook1

title: Thunderbird lost internet connection after Firefox installed
content:
I'm moving all stuff to new PC with Windows 11 preinstalled . I would like to have a fresh install. So , I install one application and its settings after another . I installed Thunderbird and its profile. Everything works fine. Then I installed Firefox (no profile, no config - only a clean install from the web). Thunderbird lost some connection to the internet - imap server is not responding, thunderbird update does not work - server not found ... and so on. After uninstalling Firefox, Thunderbird works fine again. Can you fix this issue ? Thunderbird version: 128.4.4esr (20241118214310) / User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Thunderbird/128.4.4 Firefox version: 132.0.2 9 (20241110231641) / User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:132.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/132.0 Windows 11 ver: 23H2 (build 22631.4541) Language of all SW Czech (Thunderbird cz / Firefox cz / Windows 11 cz)

Old PC - Thunderbird 115.10.1 / Firefox 132.0.1 / Win 10 22H2 build 19045.5131 - works fine
creator: hunkaj

title: TB & Logitech K270 combo
content:
Hello, I've been trying to figure out why my TB program has stopped responding to the email button on my Logitech K270 keyboard. It calls up the Windows Mail 8, but not TB. Everything else on the keyboard works fine, but it will not call up the TB program. I've tried various settings in SetPoint, 6.9, but it won't work. I've tried contacting Logitech, but so far, they've been no help, so I'm hoping somebody here, has run into the same thing, and figured it out. I mean, why would the button work for Windows Mail, but not TB?

Thanks in advance.
creator: claytonowen
